timeline.bodyText:
Just a small comment about this: I'm not a big fan of having two classes at the same level in a compilation unit, just one being not public. I would prefer to make it a public static method inside the other one, or a dedicated class in its own compilation unit.
Also, what about making it inherit from AssertJ's AbstractAssert?
https://joel-costigliola.github.io/assertj/assertj-core-custom-assertions.html
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText:
I thought about AssertJ approach. Unfortunately, I am not sure we'll benefit much from it. Cause we still have to implement all needed assertions logic.
I also changed the logic of assertions, so there is only one point to get an assertion error and we'll have all the error messages collected.
replies.author: margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource

replies.bodyText:
Fine by me :)
I just believe that the more we stay closer from how AssertJ operate, the higher is the chance to have it reused somewhere in our own tests.
replies.author: m-g-sonar
